result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Arthur Kuehn

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs court of agreement, defendant will plead guilty or no contest to count 1 in 16CF45, other cases, 17CM08, 16CM39, 17CM19 will be DRI for restitution on all cases of $2349.42; agreement State argue 2 years probation, 6 months jail, 2 days credit.  Restitution of $1000 joint & several in 16CF45.  Court advises defendant of elements/max. penalties of charge.  Defendant enters plea of no contest.  PLQ/W0RF filed with court and court reviewed with the defendant.  Court advises defendant of felony prohibitions and constitutional rights.  Defendant is a citizen of the US and court finds based upon files a factual foundation exists for the charge; finds waiver of constitutional rights and plea done K&V, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no victim impact statements.  States closing statement.  Atty Petersen closing statement and requests early discharge if pay the restitution within 1 year.  Defendant addresses the court.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 years probation and if gets everything paid off has no objection to early release; condition of probation:  Pay restitution of $2349.42, allocate $1000 restitution in 16CF45 as joint & several; 6 months in the PCJ with huber for employment, assessment or treatment; 2 days credit; pay costs of case; provide a DNA sample; comply with any assessment or counseling set up by P&P; advised of appeal rights.
Letter from Atty Petersen requesting her client be transported from Buffalo County Jail for hearing.
Status conference on February 5, 2018 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests matter be set for trial.  Felony case be scheduled first in 16CF45 as 1 day JT with other cases set for STC on FPT date of 16CF45.  Referred to JA for scheduling.
Status conference on October 9, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Peterson trying to reach Atty Rivard to get files on these matters and rest of information from DA.  Referred to JA for scheduling.  Defendant confirms address remains same.

Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There are a # of cases and Mr. Kuehn advised Atty Rivard late May that he was seeking new counsel, that's why I did not appear at the last hearing.  Defendant to follow through with seeking new counsel through PD office.  Atty Rivard remains on the cases until new counsel appt'd.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Francesco J Balistrieri of SPD.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourn to 6/20 to determine who is representing him.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Judge Duvall/Court Reporter from Buffalo County Courtroom.
Signature bond for: 16CM39, 16CF45, 17CM08, 17CM19

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant warrants issued for FTA on 5/22/17.  State notes defendant lengthy criminal history, previously failed to appear and requests $1000 cash bond.  Defendant informs he's been in contact with the PD office and spoke with Mr. Rivard the morning of his court date, appeared for court at 4:00 p.m. and spoke with P.S. who informed him to contact his atty.  Off record for Clerk to confirm if what defendant is saying is accurate.  On record.  Mr. Kuehn called late in the day, unsure if date is date of court.  Court sets $1000 signature bond and defendant to return to court on 6/6 at 2:30 p.m.  Mr. Kueh to contact Mr. Rivard.  Mr. Kuehn indicates Lisa, unsure of last name, was reassigned to his case.  Court has no information to that effect but should talk to his attorney.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant f/t/a.  Warrant requested by the State & authorized by the court.
Restitution List - L.S.W.
Plea hearing on May 22, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussions between counsel re: resoluton.  Referred to JA for scheduling all cases.

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires of defendant's address?  N1101 Sandridge Rd, Pepin.  Defendant wishes to waive right to PH and files WOPH form with court.  Court reviews defendant's right to PH, finds his WOPH done K&V, binds over.  NGP entered in 17CM08.  Any conditions of bond previously set are cont'd.  Referred to scheduling clerk for Arraignment in felony case and STC on misdemeanor matters.  Court informs defendant had 3 warrants, and today paid $500; 16FO71 was paid in full, applied $193.50 in 16FO72 with balance of $133.00 and in 16FO75 owes $326.00.  Court quashed the warrant in 16FO71, other warrants still active.  Defendant informs he will pay in full by his next court date in criminal matters.  Court quashes warrants in 16FO72 and 16FO75 and will review to determine paid by next hearing.
Status conference on March 6, 2017 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Bradley Arthur Kuehn in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of new charges in 17CM08/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant continues to waive TL for PH on felony case.  Court notes 3 other DC citations talked about last time to get paid.  Court will give you until 1/30/17 to have them paid or will sign the warrants.  Referred to scheduling clerk for another date.
Atty Francis Rivard appointed.
